alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Lee; Moore (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 2:54PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Moore, Lee and southeastern Chatham Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 253 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Goldston, or 8 miles west of Sanford, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sanford, Pittsboro, Carthage, Goldston, Broadway, Gum Springs, Moncure, Cumnock, Tramway and Glendon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central North Carolina.
